alert.note: Alert for Toombs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 9:55PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Toombs County through 1030 PM EDT... At 955 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near English Eddy, or near Plant Hatch, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... English Eddy, Toombs Central, Johnson Corner, New Branch, Cedar Crossing, and Grays Landing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Georgia.
